intro: Lefebvrea benguelensis, commonly known as the Benguela leafy vine, is a climbing plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as riverbanks and forest edges. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
